string-array.item: National Museum of Korea
The National Folk Museum of Korea
War Memorial of Korea

string-array.name: museums_addresses
string-array.item: 137 Seobinggo-ro, Seobinggo-dong, Yongsan-gu, 서울특별시 South Korea
37 Samcheong-ro, Sejongno, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
29 Itaewon-ro, Namyeong-dong, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, South Korea

string-array.name: museums_descriptions
string-array.item: The National Museum of Korea is the flagship museum of Korean history and art in South Korea and is the cultural organization that represents Korea.

National Folk Museum of Korea is a national museum of South Korea, located within the grounds of the Gyeongbokgung Palace in Jongno-gu, Seoul. It uses replicas of historical objects to illustrate the history of traditional life of the Korean people.

The War Memorial of Korea is a museum located in Yongsan-dong, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, South Korea. It opened in 1994 on the former site of the army headquarters to exhibit and memorialize the military history of Korea.

string-array.name: museums_hours
string-array.item: Everyday: 9:00–18:00
Everyday: 9:00–18:30
Everyday: 9:00–18:30

string-array.name: parks_names
string-array.item: Lotte World
Everland Resort
Seoul Land

string-array.name: parks_addresses
string-array.item: 240 Olympic-ro, Jamsil-dong, Songpa-gu, Seoul, South Korea
199 Everland-ro, Pogog-eup, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea
181 Gwangmyeong-ro, Makgye-dong, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea

string-array.name: parks_descriptions
string-array.item: Lotte World is a major recreation complex in Seoul, South Korea. It consists of the world\'s largest indoor theme park, an outdoor amusement park called "Magig Island", an artificial island inside a lake linked by monorail, a luxury hotel, a Korean folk museum, sports facilities, and movie theaters.

Everland Resort is a theme park and vacation resort located in Yongin, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea. It is owned and operated by Samsung Everland. The resort opened on April, 1976, as a single theme park, but developed into a resort with water parks, hostels, speedways, golf course and museums.

Seoul Land is an amusement park opened in 1987, in Gwacheon, a city in Gyeonggi-do province, South Korea. It is located in the Seoul Grand Park complex. It opened just before the 1988 Summer Olympics. It has about 40 rides, including roller coasters, and movie theaters. Seasonal festivals are held in the park.

string-array.name: parks_hours
string-array.item: Everyday: 09:30–23:00
Everyday: 10:00–22:00
Everyday: 09:30–23:00

string-array.name: palaces_names
string-array.item: Changdeokgung Palace
Changgyeonggung Palace
Deoksugung Palace

string-array.name: palaces_addresses
string-array.item: 99 Yulgok-ro, Waryong-dong, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
185 Changgyeonggung-ro, Waryong-dong, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
99 Sejong-daero, Jeong-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul, South Korea

string-array.name: palaces_descriptions
string-array.item: Changdeokgung, also known as Changdeokgung Palace or Changdeok Palace, is set within a large park in Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea. It is one of the "Five Grand Palaces" built by the kings of the Joseon Dynasty.

Changgyeong Palace is a palace located in Seoul, South Korea. The palace was built in the mid-15th century by King Sejong for his father, Taejong. It was originally named "Suganggung" but it was renovated and enlarged in 1483 by King Seongjong, at which time it received its current name.

Deoksugung, also known as Gyeongun-gung, Deoksugung Palace, or Deoksu Palace, is a walled compound of palaces in Seoul that was inhabited by members of Korea\'s royal family during the Joseon monarchy until the annexation of Korea by Japan in 1910.

string-array.name: palaces_hours
string-array.item: Everyday: 09:00–17:00
Everyday: 09:00–17:30
Everyday: 09:00–21:00

string-array.name: monuments_names
string-array.item: 세종대왕 동상 Statue of Sejong the Great
Gwanghwamun Gate
Statue of Gangnam Style

string-array.name: monuments_addresses
string-array.item: 172 Sejong-daero, Sejongno, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
161 Sajik-ro, Sejongno, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
East Gate of COEX Gangnam-gu, Youngdongdaero 513

string-array.name: monuments_descriptions
string-array.item: Statue of King Sejong is located at the Sejongno, Gwanghwamun Plaza in central Seoul, South Korea. It is dedicated to the 15th century Korean monarch, Sejong the Great, the fourth king of Joseon dynasty and one of Korea\'s most famous historical figures.
Gwanghwamun is the main and largest gate of Gyeongbokgung Palace, in Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea. It is located at a three-way intersection at the northern end of Sejongno.
Like the Cloud Gate of Chicago and the Charging Bull of Wall Street, a new landmark is made at the COEX East Gate, to portray Gangnam\'s own style. This is a new landmark of Gangnam.

string-array.name: monuments_hours
string-array.item: Open 24/7
Everyday: 09:00–18:00
Open 24/7

resources.string: The National Museum of Romanian History is a museum located on Calea Victoriei in Bucharest, Romania, which contains Romanian historical artifacts from prehistoric times up to modern times.
